result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor D Lucas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss charge upon pleas in 15-CF-99, 15-CF-137 and 16-CF-22. Court so orders, dismisses charge but reads in for sentencing purposes. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates 15-CF-99 is proceeding to trial on Wednesday. 15-CF-103, 15-CF-137 and 16-CF-22 will continue to track 15-CF-99. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz feels trial in 15-CF-099 can be taken off the calendar, feels all matters will resolve short of trial. State feels it's premature to remove trial from the calendar. State/Defense request another status. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Trevor D Lucas
Current: 713 N. 4th Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 02-15-2016)
Prior: 317 S 4th Avenue Upper, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, indicates 15-CF-99 is in the #1 position for trial.  Atty Reetz indicates matter is still heading toward trial. Defense just learned of the new charges, may change the scope of all pending matters. Atty Reetz requests a status before the scheduled trial date. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz asks court to set all pending cases for trial. Court will set 15-CF-99 for trial first. This file and 15-CF-137 will continue to track 15-CF-99. Bond remains in effect.
Court appointed atty bill from Atty Reetz. Court approves bill.
Defense Discovery Demand
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz feels matter will resolve short of trial, requests another status date. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees
Court appoints Atty Brett Reetz to represent defendant.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews petition for court appointed attorney. Court appoints Atty Brett Reetz to represent defendant. Atty Reetz due in court at 11:00, Court will recall case when he gets here. Back in session. Atty Reetz accepts court appointment. Defendant to pay $75 per month toward atty fees. First payment due by 9/30/15. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD representation, requests court appointed atty. Defendant to fill out form and return. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 8/01/15. (fingerprint card destroyed 3/01/16)
by Rachel Hein
No contact direct or indirect with C.T.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Trevor D Lucas appears by video conference.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
